title: Bi-Weekly Career and Hiring Discussion Thread
selftext:
Hello r/india! If you need any suggestions/help regarding your career, ask here. If your company is hiring or if you are looking for a job, then post here.

**If You or Your Company is Hiring:**

1. Name of the company
2. Location
3. Requirements
4. Preferred way of contacting you

**If You are looking to get hired**

1. Your skillset/experience
2. Portfolio (if any/applicable)
3. Location
4. Preferred way of contacting you

Please do not mention your emails. You can/should prefer to take conversation forward in PMs instead to avoid any privacy mishaps.

Do follow up here with your experience. Did you get a job or hire someone successfully via these threads? Your feedback helps!

**Career Thread is posted every two weeks on Thursday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Career+and+Hiring+thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/osdztmrfx8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=dab56a83877ffe7dc6fd93767a8f63e9c366e592
comments:
We are Hiring  
1. [ServiceNow](https://www.servicenow.com/) \- It's a listed **product** company on [NYSE](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/NOW/) working in the enterprise space.   
2. Location - Hyderabad/Bengaluru  
3. Role - Senior/Staff UX Designer (5+ years of experience)  
4. You can message me for details
if someone is associated with a staffing firm, can he/she post the requirements ?

Question. 

My sister is a MSc student and a major project of her requires her to have internship experience. 
So, she contacted some IIT/IISC (Apparantly I don't remember) for any available internships. 

Those institute folks responded positively, but the internship is "reversed", which means my sister has to pay Rs. 30,000 for an onsite internship, travelling and staying charges, do free work for them, all this for just an internship experience for a project. 

Is this shit even legal?

That's possibly a scam.

Govt institutions don't ask for money.
